SEARCH
Package com.example.chicksevent

Class EventQRCodeTest

java.lang.Object
com.example.chicksevent.EventQRCodeTest
public class EventQRCodeTest extends Object
Unit tests for US 02.01.01: As an organizer I want to create a new event and generate a unique promotional QR code that links to the event description and event poster in the app. These tests validate that:
  • Events can be created with unique IDs
  • QR codes are generated with correct deep link format
  • QR codes link to the event (which contains description and poster)
  • Each event gets a unique QR code

    • organizer_createEvent_generatesUniqueEventId

      public void organizer_createEvent_generatesUniqueEventId() throws Exception
      Test Case 1: Organizer can create a new event with a unique ID. As an organizer, when I create a new event, it should be assigned a unique event ID that can be used for QR code generation.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • organizer_qrCodeDeepLink_hasCorrectFormat

      public void organizer_qrCodeDeepLink_hasCorrectFormat()
      Test Case 2: QR code deep link is generated with correct format for an event. As an organizer, when a QR code is generated for my event, it should contain a deep link in the format "chicksevent://event/{eventId}".

    • organizer_qrCodeDeepLink_containsEventId

      public void organizer_qrCodeDeepLink_containsEventId()
      Test Case 3: QR code deep link contains the correct event ID. As an organizer, the QR code deep link should contain my event's unique ID so it links to the correct event.

    • organizer_qrCodeBitmap_generatedFromDeepLink

      public void organizer_qrCodeBitmap_generatedFromDeepLink()
      Test Case 4: Deep link is generated correctly for QR code creation. As an organizer, when a QR code is generated, it should use a deep link that correctly references the event. Note: Actual bitmap generation requires Android runtime and is tested in instrumented tests. This unit test verifies the deep link format.

    • organizer_differentEvents_generateDifferentQRCodes

      public void organizer_differentEvents_generateDifferentQRCodes()
      Test Case 5: Different events generate different QR codes. As an organizer, each event I create should have a unique QR code that links to that specific event.

    • organizer_qrCodeDeepLink_formatIsConsistent

      public void organizer_qrCodeDeepLink_formatIsConsistent()
      Test Case 6: QR code deep link format is consistent across events. As an organizer, all QR codes should follow the same deep link format regardless of the event ID, ensuring consistent behavior.

    • organizer_createEvent_thenGenerateQRCode_worksTogether

      public void organizer_createEvent_thenGenerateQRCode_worksTogether() throws Exception
      Test Case 7: Event creation and QR code generation work together. As an organizer, when I create an event, I should be able to generate a QR code using the event's ID that links back to the event.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • organizer_qrCodeDeepLink_handlesSpecialEventIds

      public void organizer_qrCodeDeepLink_handlesSpecialEventIds()
      Test Case 8: QR code deep link correctly formats event IDs with special characters. As an organizer, even if my event ID contains special characters or unusual formats, the QR code deep link should still be generated correctly.

    • organizer_qrCodeBitmap_canBeSavedToFile

      public void organizer_qrCodeBitmap_canBeSavedToFile() throws Exception
      Test Case 9: QR code save method handles null bitmap gracefully. As an organizer, the QR code save functionality should handle edge cases gracefully, such as when bitmap generation fails. Note: In unit tests, bitmap generation is not available. This test verifies the save method handles null correctly. Actual bitmap saving is tested in instrumented tests.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • organizer_eventWithDescriptionAndPoster_canGenerateQRCode

      public void organizer_eventWithDescriptionAndPoster_canGenerateQRCode() throws Exception
      Test Case 10: Event with description and poster can have QR code generated. As an organizer, when I create an event with a description and poster, I should be able to generate a QR code that links to this event, allowing others to view the description and poster.
      Throws:
      Exception
